function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Localised supply chains are found to be more vulnerable to shocks for most countries.","Impact":"Stability of real GDP, real production and real consumption declines in the face of shocks.","Mitigation":"Diversification of supplies, increased flexibility for adjustment, and reduced reliance on domestic markets.","Technologies":"Supply chain management software, risk assessment tools, and trade optimization platforms.","People":"Countries with localised supply chains.","Owner":"Government, trade organizations, and industry associations."},{"Description":"Domestic shocks account for about half of the variation in real GDP due to shocks, illustrating that domestic shocks may be at least as important as a source of instability as foreign shocks.","Impact":"Increased instability in real GDP due to domestic shocks.","Mitigation":"Investment in domestic resilience, backup supply chains, and shock-resistant infrastructure.","Technologies":"Resilience planning software, supply chain mapping tools, and infrastructure monitoring systems.","People":"National governments, local businesses, and supply chain managers.","Owner":"Governments, local businesses, and supply chain management firms."},{"Description":"For 16 out of 22 countries or regions included in the model, real GDP stability falls when all shocks are considered.","Impact":"Decreased stability of real GDP for the majority of countries.","Mitigation":"Enhanced risk assessment, development of adaptive policies, and targeted support for vulnerable regions.","Technologies":"Data analytics tools, simulation modeling software, and predictive analytics platforms.","People":"Policy makers, regional authorities, and economic analysts.","Owner":"Government agencies, research institutions, and economic development organizations."}]}
